attributes.action: Keep outdoor tennis open during lockdown 2 for singles and household bubbles
attributes.additional_details:
There is no logic to ban playing of tennis when playing within a household at all and the physical and mental benefit is huge - especially given it’s an outdoor activity.
Further, singles should be allowed with distancing because the broader rules allow taking of exercise with one other in a public setting. If transmission via tennis balls is a concern, players can simply serve using their own balls and not touch the other players balls as we did before.
attributes.background: Allow outdoor tennis for singles or household bubbles, possibly with additional guidance about not sharing balls as we did in lockdown 1

rejection.details:
You may wish to sign some of these petitions:

Allow indoor/outdoor tennis courts to operate under strict distancing protocols: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557428

Exempt outdoor tennis from closure due to COVID-19: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/557658
